definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: I turned into the dirt road and followed it through encroaching trees and bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我转上土路，在蔓延至路面的树木和灌木间穿行。

sentences.english: Jeff had just turned left down a dirt road.
sentences.chinese: 杰夫将车向左拐上了一条土路。

sentences.english: "Is this bit dirt road or paved?" I asked while pointing at the map.
sentences.chinese: “这一段是泥土路还是好路？”我指着地图问。

sentences.english: Miao-Feng Road, formerly the dirt roads, rugged.
sentences.chinese: 妙峰古道，原为土路，崎岖难行。

sentences.english: Turn right where the highway meets the dirt road.
sentences.chinese: 在公路和土路交叉的地方向右拐弯。

sentences.english: Bonny, take the next dirt track on the left.
sentences.chinese: 邦妮，走左边那条泥土路，它可以将我们带到山谷里。

sentences.english: Dirt track stockcar 11 racing is a contact sport, and we made good contact.
sentences.chinese: 土路跑车赛是一种接触性运动，我们接触得很精彩。

sentences.english: It was a dirt road bordered by a dry ditch .
sentences.chinese: 这是一条土路，路旁有条干沟。

sentences.english: Now, no more abut the pit road, convenient for people to walk.
sentences.chinese: 如今，再也没有那坑哇哇的土路，让人们行走方便。

sentences.english: I drove along a quiet dirt road in the mountains near Fairplay, Colorado.
sentences.chinese: 我沿着科罗拉多州靠近费尔普莱的安静泥土路驾车。

sentences.english: In front of their house was a small dirt road.
sentences.chinese: 在他们的房子前面是一条很小的土路。

sentences.english: It was basically a one-lane dirt road with heavy traffic in both directions.
sentences.chinese: 基本上这就是条土路，两边交通还异常繁忙。

definition: road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
road or pavement laid with flagstones
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
